page.title: 12GOXHILL YOUTH CENTRE.
page.content: The Youth Centre is in the old school building which was built as a Wesleyan Day School in 1855. The school was in use until 1976 when the new school was opened. Since then the field and part of the playground have been sold and had residential properties built upon them. The school and the adjoining school house were empty until it was decided that they should become the home of the Youth Centre. The building was decorated by a band of volunteers. The Youth Club meets each Monday and Wednesday from 6 to 9 p.m.; Brownies on Tuesdays from 5.30 to 6.45 followed by Guides until 8 p.m. On Thursdays the Cubs meet from 6.30 to 8 p.m. and the Scouts use the premises on Fridays. Discos are held on some Saturday evenings. The Centre has dart boards, snooker and table tennis tables and two electronic games.
